page.title: 07TRANSPORT IN THE BROUGH AREA
page.content: TRANSPORT IS VERY POOR IN BROUGH THE SERVICE BUSES STOPPED COMPLETELY ON THE 18TH OF MAY 1985.NOW THERE IS ONLY A SCHOOL BUS GOING TO KIRKBY STEPHEN.A FEW YEARS AGO THE CLOCK HAD TO BE MOVED BACK 4 FEET TO MAKE WAY FOR THE TRAFFIC WHEN THE BRIDGE WAS BUILT,BEFORE THE BY PASS WAS MADE BROUGH WAS A LOT BUSIER BECAUSE ALL THE CARS HAD TO GO THROUGH BROUGH TO GET ONTO THE A66. THERE ALSO USED TO BE A TRAIN GOING NEAR BROUGH BUT A MAN CALLED MR BEECHINGS STOPPED IT.NOW THERE IS ONLY A LITTLE PART OF THE RAILWAY LEFT TO TO TAKE AMMUNITION TO THE ARMY CAMP AT WARCOP. EVERY ONE HAS TO HAVE ETHER A CAR OR A MOTORBIKE TO GO ANYWHERE LIKE APPLEBY AND PENRITH.
